page.title: 17RIVER WYE AND WYE BRIDGE
page.content: The River Wye rises in the Plynlimon Range and runs into the sea in the Bristol Channel.It passes through Builth where it is joined by the Irfon.There are two bridges in Builth, one over the Wye and one over the Irfon.There used to be a ford through the Wye at Builth before a bridge was built.The present bridge is built of local stone but there was an earlier wooden bridge. The community of Builth developed because of this crossing place. The river used to flood badly, but things have improved since a flood prevention scheme was introduced.It is a very clean river and we try to keep it that way.The river is famous throughout England and Wales for its salmon and trout and many fishermen visit its banks every year.Canoeists are also very fond of the Wye.
